last_episode_to_air.name: Bermuda Triangle's Greatest Mysteries
last_episode_to_air.overview: The team unveils the greatest mysteries of the Bermuda Triangle; wreck divers Mike Barnette, Jimmy Gadomski, and team investigators provide inside information on what may have happened to the most famous missing ships and planes.

name: The Bermuda Triangle: Into Cursed Waters
original_name: The Bermuda Triangle: Into Cursed Waters
overview: An elite team is investigating the Bermuda Triangle with the aid of a secret weapon—a map, decades in the making, marking the location of unidentified undersea wrecks and anomalies. Each week they will attempt to identify one mystery wreck, along the way evaluating the evidence behind legends and scientific theories like rogue waves, giant methane bubbles, ship-sucking whirlpools, and dead zones that bewilder equipment and planes. In the Bermuda Triangle, one never knows what one will find. On the ocean floor, the team makes historic and important discoveries that go beyond myth and conjecture.

episodes.name: A Big Find
episodes.overview: An elite team investigates the mysteries of the Bermuda Triangle aided by a secret map decades in the making. In this episode, they attempt to unravel the mystery of why 27 US Navy aviators and crew vanished without a trace on the same night in 1945. While searching for the wrecks of the lost planes they uncover a debris field unlike any they have ever seen, and one with historic implications.

episodes.name: Rogue Waves
episodes.overview: The team dives deep looking for the biggest vessel to ever vanish in the Bermuda Triangle–a massive ship with a monstrous name–the USS Cyclops. Was the USS Cyclops the victim of a terrifying, ship-sinking phenomenon known as a rogue wave? While searching the deep waters, they uncover harrowing stories of other rogue waves prowling the seas and make a discovery that solves a century old mystery.

episodes.name: Holes in the Ocean
episodes.overview: The team searches for the remains of an entire pirate fleet of ships that vanished suddenly in the Bermuda Triangle, as if swallowed by the ocean. Could a geological anomaly be the source of these ship-sucking whirlpools? Their investigation takes them to the literal bottom of a fabled–and potentially deadly–mid-ocean sinkhole, but what they find waiting in the depths may prove beyond any mystery.

episodes.name: Spies in the Deep
episodes.overview:
The team signs up one of the most advanced research ships on the planet to search the depths for a lost secret weapon of the Pentagon's arsenal--a top-secret spy plane that vanished into the Bermuda Triangle. Are planes and ships falling victim to a terrifying ocean storm called a white squall? The skies darken as the team pushes deep into dangerous waters attempting to identify whether the plane was lost to freak weather, or something even darker.

Path

episodes.name: Alien Abyss
episodes.overview: The team enlists special equipment in an epic search for two large air force planes that vanished without a trace with dozens of people on board; despite a massive search, nothing was ever found.

episodes.name: Death From Below
episodes.overview: Enlisting an advanced submarine to probe one of the deepest, darkest parts of the Bermuda Triangle in search of a legendary ship that vanished in 1921; considering whether massive bubbles are opening up in the floor of the Bermuda Triangle.

episodes.name: Curse of the Carrier
episodes.overview: The team dives in search of an A3 Skywarrior attack aircraft that was lost in a suspicious disaster off the USS Saratoga aircraft carrier in 1960.

episodes.name: The Missing Giants
episodes.overview: The team sets its sights on a famous Bermuda Triangle case: the twin vanishings of two massive cargo ships; in 1941, the USS Proteus disappears after crossing the Bermuda Triangle; two weeks later, the USS Nereus, also drops off the Earth.

episodes.name: Into the Magnetic Storm
episodes.overview: The team seeks out the wreck of the Revonoc, a racing yacht that vanished in 1958 with a crew of five; a freak magnetic anomaly was detected in the Triangle when she went missing.

episodes.name: Triangle of Madness
episodes.overview: The team thinks a 300-foot wreck off the tip of Florida just might be the Sudoffco - a steel freighter lost in 1926 with 29 men while traveling through the Triangle from New Jersey to the Panama Canal. A land station reported hearing a faint, desperate SOS around the time she went missing. Was she taken out by severe coastal storms? Or did her crew succumb to a bizarre condition that might drive sailors mad and cause them to jump overboard in the Bermuda Triangle?

episodes.name: The White Whale
episodes.overview: Mike Barnette, Jimmy Gadomski and the rest of the team of investigators are back on the trail of a famous cold case that keeps them up at night: the disappearance of seven U.S. Navy planes in 1945.

episodes.name: Killer Queen
episodes.overview: In the dead of night, the team heads to a remote target they believe to be the long-lost Marine Sulphur Queen; this massive tanker disappeared in 1963 with a crew of 39 and is one of the most iconic missing Bermuda Triangle wrecks.

episodes.name: Bermuda Triangle's First Blood
episodes.overview: An elite team investigates the Bermuda Triangle with the aid of a map marking the location of unidentified undersea wrecks and anomalies; evaluating theories like rogue waves, giant methane bubbles and dead zones that bewilder equipment and planes.

episodes.name: Pirates in the Caribbean
episodes.overview: Are modern-day pirates prowling the Bermuda Triangle in search of victims? The team takes on the twisted case of a missing luxury boat called the Saba Bank lost in the vicinity of the Bermuda Triangle in 1974. This case was blamed on the Bermuda Triangle, but new leads suggest even deadlier forces were responsible. Divers Mike Barnette and Jimmy Gadomski consult their map of secret wrecks and dive in search of the Saba Bank, while the land investigators unravel alleged connections to the Mafia and cartel villains.

episodes.name: Graveyard of the Atlantic
episodes.overview:
« Previous Ep. Next Ep. »

The team has secret intel on a wreck that might be a legendary 1930s disappearance: the champion racing yacht known as Ingomar. Lured by a strange light, the Ingomar's seasoned crew smashes into an unseen obstacle, even though their charts show clear water. The crew escapes in a lifeboat only for the Ingomar to vanish behind them, never to be seen again. Now wreck hunters Mike Barnette and Jimmy Gadomski have found an artifact-rich wreck site that could be the long-lost yacht. Meanwhile, the rest of the team investigates the strange phenomena that lurk in the Graveyard of the Atlantic. What doomed the Ingomar?

episodes.name: Eye of the Cyclops
episodes.overview: The team has a chance to finally solve the case of the U.S.S. Cyclops; missing since 1918 with 309 sailors, this 500-foot freighter represents the single deadliest Bermuda Triangle loss.

episodes.name: Bermuda Triangle's Greatest Mysteries
episodes.overview: The team unveils the greatest mysteries of the Bermuda Triangle; wreck divers Mike Barnette, Jimmy Gadomski, and team investigators provide inside information on what may have happened to the most famous missing ships and planes.
